extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addGameElements(GameElements element)
      This method adds a element to the ArrayList, it has to be called(1 time) in the start of each game, to add elements to the game
      void changeMapKey()
      This method is useful for the Dungeon Map, once the hero picks the key this method is called to change all doors from closed to open
      void changeMapOgreKey()
      This method is useful for the OgreMap, once the hero picks the lever doors remain closed, they just open when hero is one position away from the doors
      void cleanActualMap()
      This method is called on every move of the game, and removes from board all elements from last iteration
      void colisoes(GameElements g1)
      This method is called in function setGame for every element of the game, it checks the logic colisions for all the maps
      static char[][] CopyCharMatrix(char[][] input)
      This method creates a clone (copy of a matrix) of the initial map that was passed through the GameMap class
      double distancePoints(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Auxiliar method to calculate distance between two points, it's used in colisions

      This method returns the actual game board

      This method returns the ArrayList

      This method returns the gameover boolean, wich indicates if the Hero has lost the game

      This method is responsible for moving the Hero in game

      This method is called with the intention of checking if Hero will pick the key in his next move (OgreMap), if it does it changes the hero symbol to 'K' and removes the key from map

      Prints the current map state that is passed by getActualMap method

      this method is responsible for setting all current characters in the board, it's called every move of the game before printing the board

      This method set's the key value to true or false
      void setkeypos()
      There was a need to get the x and y position of the key in any map, this method goes through a map, and saves the keyx and keyy position for the key in that map

      This is a bool indicating if level2 is currently the map

      • GameLogic

        public GameLogic(GameMap map)
        This constructor creates a logic associated with a specific GameMap
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • printboard

        public void printboard()
        Prints the current map state that is passed by getActualMap method
        See Also:
        GameLogic.getActualMap()

      • getHeroPosAtArray

        public int getHeroPosAtArray()
        returns it(int) to Hero position in ArrayList elements
        Returns:
        Hero is indentified by char 'H' or 'K' or 'A'

      • getHeroPosition

        public Others.Pair getHeroPosition()
        This method constructs a pair with the current Hero position in the gameboard
        Returns:
        A constructed Pair calling method getx() and gety() that return the position in board for any element
        See Also:
        Pair

      • moveHero

        public boolean moveHero(char direction)
        This method is responsible for moving the Hero in game
        Parameters:
        direction - It's a char specified by the player in game, w=up , a=left, s=down, d=right
        Returns:
        boolean, if true hero was able to move and hero positions were updated, if false nothing changed

      • setLevel2

        public void setLevel2()
        This is a bool indicating if level2 is currently the map

      • setGameWin

        public void setGameWin(boolean win)
        This method is used to set private atribute gamewin
        Parameters:
        win - If win value is true the Hero has won the game! It's initiated as false.

      • getGameWin

        public boolean getGameWin()
        Returns:
        Returns the GameWin boolean
        See Also:
        setGameWin

      • setMap

        public void setMap(GameMap m)
        This method set's the current map that is being played
        Parameters:
        m - Recieves a type GameMap param
        See Also:
        GameMap, DungeonMap,OgreMap and setMap function

      • getMap

        public GameMap getMap()
        This method returns the current map that is being played
        Returns:
        A type GameMap, GameMap is an interface and DungeonMap and OgreMap both implement GameMap

      • setGameOver

        public void setGameOver(boolean over)
        This method set's the gameover boolean, wich indicates if the Hero has lost the game
        Parameters:
        over - if true Hero has lost the game, it's initiated as false

      • getGameOver

        public boolean getGameOver()
        This method returns the gameover boolean, wich indicates if the Hero has lost the game
        Returns:
        gameOver

      • addGameElements

        public void addGameElements(GameElements element)
        This method adds a element to the ArrayList, it has to be called(1 time) in the start of each game, to add elements to the game
        Parameters:
        element - it's any character of the game

      • getGameElements

        public java.util.ArrayList<GameElements> getGameElements()
        This method returns the ArrayList
        Returns:
        returns a vector with all the characters that are in the current game

      • setKey

        public void setKey(boolean key)
        This method set's the key value to true or false
        Parameters:
        key - true if Hero has the key in possession, it's initialized as false

      • getKey

        public boolean getKey()
        This method returns the key value
        Returns:
        key true if Hero has the key in possession, it's initialized as false

      • pickKey

        public boolean pickKey(int x,
                       int y)
        This method is called with the intention of checking if Hero will pick the key in his next move (OgreMap), if it does it changes the hero symbol to 'K' and removes the key from map
        Parameters:
        x - is the x value in the map
        y - is the y value in the map
        Returns:
        boolean, true if hero has caught the key, false if hero landed on every other position that isn't the key position

      • getActualMap

        public char[][] getActualMap()
        This method returns the actual game board
        Returns:
        a [][]char matrix that is the current board

      • cleanActualMap

        public void cleanActualMap()
        This method is called on every move of the game, and removes from board all elements from last iteration

      • setGame

        public void setGame()
        this method is responsible for setting all current characters in the board, it's called every move of the game before printing the board

      • CopyCharMatrix

        public static char[][] CopyCharMatrix(char[][] input)
        This method creates a clone (copy of a matrix) of the initial map that was passed through the GameMap class
        Parameters:
        input - recieves a char[][] matrix from the OgreMap or DungeonMap class
        Returns:
        a char[][] copy of that matrix

      • changeMapKey

        public void changeMapKey()
        This method is useful for the Dungeon Map, once the hero picks the key this method is called to change all doors from closed to open

      • changeMapOgreKey

        public void changeMapOgreKey()
        This method is useful for the OgreMap, once the hero picks the lever doors remain closed, they just open when hero is one position away from the doors

      • testKey

        public boolean testKey(int x,
                       int y)
        This method is useful for checking if Hero has picked the key
        Parameters:
        x - position in column
        y - position in line
        Returns:
        boolean, true is x,y conrresponds to key position

      • setkeypos

        public void setkeypos()
        There was a need to get the x and y position of the key in any map, this method goes through a map, and saves the keyx and keyy position for the key in that map

      • testWin

        public void testWin(GameElements g1)
        This method checks whether the Hero has moved to a open door therefore winning the game
        Parameters:
        g1 - Hero, only works with characters 'H','A','K'

        public double distancePoints(double x1,

      • colisoes

        public void colisoes(GameElements g1)
        This method is called in function setGame for every element of the game, it checks the logic colisions for all the maps
        Parameters:
        g1 - any game element
